message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CR 

The paper proposes a novel model for one-class novelty detection using a denoising auto-encoder network and adversarial training. This work involves deep learning techniques and focuses on computer vision applications, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves the use of a discriminator, which is a common technique in Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), indicating that it could also belong to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of detecting out-of-class examples, which is related to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
